timeline.message: changes needed for removing sourcefile refs in UI

timeline.bodyText:
There's no reason to create a TreeSet here, because you overwrite it on line 186. I would just get rid of this line and define it on line 186.
Or, more subjectively, not not declare it at all and just return line 186 directly.
timeline.author: coverbeck

timeline.bodyText: Scares me a little if a null value gets introduced, then this migration will fail. I see it's never null in my Jul 24 snapshot, so maybe it's OK. And maybe if we run into this, we should fix it, so yeah, perhaps. Just thinking out loud.
timeline.author: coverbeck

replies.bodyText:
If we merge this change, we should make a special note to the wiki instructions for the 1.10 release to make sure we test the migration with a recent DB.
In some cases we can calculate and populate this value in database, but it might be more trouble than it is worth if it is never null yet.
replies.author: denis-yuen

replies.bodyText: Saw another annotation that makes the fields required, but doesn't need a migration.
replies.author: NatalieEO

timeline.bodyText:
This is unfortunate, but may be fast enough for a single version, so probably not worth optimizing yet.
Why do you use a TreeSet instead of Collectors.toSet? TreeSet sorts, but for an enum it's just going to sort on the order of declaration, I think, and I don't think that order is significant. I could be wrong though.
timeline.author: coverbeck

replies.bodyText: On further reflection, it probably is better to use TreeSet. Although the particular  ordering doesn’t really matter much, the fact that it will return the same order every time is a good thing.
replies.author: coverbeck

timeline.message: Use another annotation that doesn't create a migration
Fix permission issues and add tests

timeline.bodyText: last comma has space in front of it instead of after it. :)
timeline.author: coverbeck

timeline.bodyText: checkUser will fail with an NPE if user is null, which user.get() can return.
timeline.author: coverbeck

timeline.bodyText: Suggest "Retrieve the unique file types of a version's sourcefiles"
timeline.author: coverbeck
coverbeck

timeline.bodyText:
I believe you should return a 404 in this case. If you go to a private GitHub repo that you don't have permissions to, you get a 404, not an unauthorized error.
The logic behind this is that you don't even want to indicate that it exists to an evil-doer. If they know it exists, that's the first step. Then they could then start trying to break into it.
I'll let others opine on this.
timeline.author: coverbeck
garyluu
garyluu

timeline.bodyText: I think the other pattern (where we put the assertFail() right after this line) is cleaner since there's less code and no extra boolean.
timeline.author: garyluu

timeline.bodyText: Assertion to check that the exception error message is what's expected
timeline.author: garyluu

timeline.message: Test error messages, don't use boolean
